title: 114_hr4370
content: The "Compact Impact Relief Act of 2016" may be cited as the Act. It includes an FMAP adjustment for affected jurisdictions equivalent to compact migrant expenditures. The "Compact Impact Relief Act of 2016" authorizes an increase in the FMAP for affected jurisdictions based on estimated compact migrant expenditures submitted by the chief executive official. The Secretary of the Interior reviews and adjusts the estimation before submitting it to the Secretary of Health and Human Services. The Secretary of Health and Human Services estimates the increase in FMAP for affected jurisdictions based on compact migrant expenditures submitted by the chief executive official. The increase in FMAP cannot exceed certain limitations under the Social Security Act. The Secretary of Health and Human Services notifies chief executive officials of the increase in FMAP estimated for affected jurisdictions. Chief executive officials must submit an accounting of compact migrant expenditures for each quarter with payment adjustments reviewed by the Secretary of the Interior. The Secretary of Health and Human Services, in consultation with the Secretary of the Interior, specifies the process for reviewing accounting of compact migrant expenditures. The Secretary of Health and Human Services adjusts Federal payments to affected jurisdictions based on the increase in FMAP, ensuring equivalence with the final accounting submitted by the Secretary of the Interior. The Secretary of Health and Human Services adjusts Federal payments to affected jurisdictions based on the increase in FMAP, ensuring equivalence with the final accounting submitted by the Secretary of the Interior. The FMAP for an affected jurisdiction cannot exceed 100 percent, and compact migrant expenditures are not considered medical assistance under title XIX of the Social Security Act. The term "compact migrant expenditures" refers to non-Federal funds spent by affected jurisdictions on healthcare for qualified nonimmigrants, as defined in the Compact of Free Association Amendments Act of 2003. This includes payments to healthcare providers for services not covered under title XIX of the Social Security Act. The term "FMAP" refers to the Federal medical assistance percentage under the Social Security Act. A conforming amendment to the Act is made regarding the Compact Impact Relief Act of 2016. SEC. 3. PAYMENTS RELATING TO ELEMENTARY AND SECONDARY EDUCATION OF CITIZENS OF FREELY ASSOCIATED STATES. The Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 is amended to include educating alien children from the Freely Associated States as citizens of the United States. Additionally, payments for eligible federally connected children now include those who resided in the US as citizens of the Republic of the Marshall Islands, the Federated States of Micronesia, or the Republic of Palau. The Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 is amended to include educating alien children from the Freely Associated States as citizens of the United States. Additional funding of $10,000,000 is authorized annually for eligible federally connected children, including those from the Republic of the Marshall Islands, the Federated States of Micronesia, or the Republic of Palau. SEC. 4 amends the Housing and Community Development Act to give preference to US citizens or nationals over aliens for housing financial assistance in Guam and the Northern Mariana Islands. SEC. 5 calls for an independent assessment of the strategic relationship between the US and the Marshall Islands, Micronesia, and Palau. The Secretary of State seeks an agreement with an organization to assess the strategic importance of the US relationship with the Marshall Islands, Micronesia, and Palau, including the Asia-Pacific re-balance and security. Assessments will cover US agencies' capabilities in administering the Compacts of Free Association and financial support to Palau. The eligible organization will assess the US relationship with the Marshall Islands, Micronesia, and Palau, focusing on the Compacts of Free Association and financial support to Palau. A report with recommendations on improvements, renewal of Compacts, and other relevant matters will be submitted to the Secretary of State within one year. The report required under paragraph (1) shall be submitted in unclassified form, but may contain a classified annex if necessary. The eligible organization entering into an agreement under this section can obtain official data directly from any US department or agency to carry out the requirements. Upon request, the head of the department or agency must provide the necessary information to the organization.
